faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about our services

questions.question: How long does the process take?
questions.answer: Processing times vary by service: TRC takes 5-7 days, work permits take 3 weeks, and company registration takes 2-4 months. We provide detailed timelines during consultation.

questions.question: Do I need to be in Vietnam to apply?
questions.answer: For most services, you'll need to be in Vietnam for document submission and biometric collection. We can advise on specific requirements during your consultation.

questions.question: What languages do you support?
questions.answer: We provide services in English, Vietnamese, Chinese (Simplified), and Korean. All documents are translated and certified as needed.

questions.question: How do I get started?
questions.answer: Book a free consultation through our website or email us at jos@iamjosaguiar.com. We'll assess your needs and provide a clear roadmap.

questions.question: What's the difference between a visa and TRC?
questions.answer: A visa allows entry and short-term stays (usually up to 90 days), while a TRC permits long-term residence (1-3 years) without needing visa extensions.

questions.question: Can I work with a TRC?
questions.answer: A TRC alone doesn't authorize employment. You'll also need a work permit to legally work in Vietnam.

questions.question: How do I renew my TRC?
questions.answer: We handle renewals with the same efficiency as new applications. Contact us 2-3 months before expiry to ensure continuity.

questions.question: What qualifications do I need for a work permit?
questions.answer: Generally, you need a university degree or 3+ years of relevant work experience, plus a clean criminal record and health clearance.

questions.question: Can my employer handle the work permit?
questions.answer: Yes, but many employers prefer to use specialists like us to ensure compliance and avoid delays. We can work directly with your HR department.

questions.question: What happens if I change jobs?
questions.answer: You'll need a new work permit for the new employer. We can help transfer and expedite the process.

questions.question: Can foreigners own 100% of a company in Vietnam?
questions.answer: Yes, most business sectors allow 100% foreign ownership. Some sectors like media and education have restrictions. We'll advise based on your business type.

questions.question: What's the minimum capital requirement?
questions.answer: There's no legal minimum for most businesses, but you should have sufficient capital to operate. Banking requirements typically start at $5,000 equivalent.

questions.question: Do I need a Vietnamese partner?
questions.answer: No, foreign-owned LLCs don't require a local partner. However, you'll need a legal representative who can be foreign or Vietnamese.

questions.question: What ongoing compliance is required?
questions.answer: Monthly accounting, quarterly tax filings, annual reports, and license renewals. Our Annual Compliance package handles everything.
